problems.text: A population of rabbits quadruples every 3 months. If there are 2 rabbits initially, how many after 12 months?
problems.hint: The population multiplies by 4 every 3 months. After 12 months, that’s 4 intervals.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: An investor deposits $1500 at 6% interest compounded annually. What will it be worth after 10 years?
problems.hint: Each year, the investment multiplies by 1.06.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A ball bounces to 7/10 of its previous height each time. Dropped from 5 meters, how high is the 9th bounce?
problems.hint: Each bounce is 0.7 times the previous height.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A tree grows 8% taller each year. If current height is 4 meters, what is height after 15 years?
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A mold doubles every 2 days. If it starts at 1.5 grams, what is its weight on the 10th day?
problems.hint: Ten days means 5 periods of doubling.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)

problems.text: A savings account deposits $800 annually, earning 7% compounded yearly. What is the value of the 15th deposit after 15 years?
problems.hint: Each year, multiply by 1.07. Find the value of the 15th deposit.
steps: Use the formula: an = a1 × r^(n-1)
